intro: Deschampsia atropurpurea var. payettii, commonly known as Payett’s purple grass, is a variant of the purple grass species native to North America. It is a perennial grass characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and distinctive purple-tinged foliage. The plant produces slender, spike-like inflorescences that bear small, spikelet-based flowers. It thrives in moist to wet environments, often found in bogs, marshes, and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems and a subject of ecological study.
